question: 訳す
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>translate</kanji> so the verb version would be <vocabulary>to translate</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading for the kanji part is surprisingly the <ja>やく</ja> you learned with it, even you wouldn't expect that. I suppose that's the kind of thing you have to look forward to if you were to go into translating.
